collectors.title: Database
collectors.titleDetails: (42 total Queries, 42 of them unique across 1 Connection)

queries.sql: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>1. In respect of any material accounting estimates from the prior period, review how they have been utilised in the current period to determine their reasonableness.</p>\r\n<p><i>If this work has been undertaken in other sections of the file a summary schedule should be produced to allow an overall conclusion to be reached.</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>2. Ensure that Appendix 1.7 (Accounting Estimates) has been completed and concluded.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>3. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>LAW AND REGULATION</h6> <p>4. Obtain details of the law and regulations which:</p> <ul> <li> are central to the continuing operation of the entity; or</li> <li> would lead to a material financial penalty if not complied with; or</li> <li> are a contractual or licensing arrangement which is of critical importance to the entity; or</li> <li> otherwise could have a material effect on the operation of the entity.</li> </ul> <p>Ensure that the permanent file has also been updated with these details.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>5. Discuss with management procedures for compliance with relevant law and regulations. Ensure the permanent file has also been updated with these details.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>6. Review the following for evidence of non-compliance with law and regulations:</p> <ul> <li> correspondence with legal advisors and regulatory bodies;</li> <li> correspondence with government bodies (including taxation authorities);</li> <li> shareholder and board minutes; and</li> <li> reports commissioned from experts.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>7. Consider the entity’s knowledge of employment law. Are there procedures in place to adequately consider areas such as the following, where legislation covers the relevant areas:</p> <ul> <li>data protection, surveillance and privacy at work;</li> <li>discrimination (covering age (including retirement); disability, race, religion, sex and sexual orientation);</li> <li>discipline and grievance procedures;</li> <li>employee status;</li> <li>equal pay;</li> <li>fixed-term working;</li> <li>flexible working, parental rights and family-friendly procedures;</li> <li>maternity, paternity, shared parental and adoption leave and pay;</li> <li>minimum and living wage;</li> <li>part time working;</li> <li>recruitment and selection;</li> <li>redundancy;</li> <li>terms and conditions of employment;</li> <li>trade union recognition and industrial action;</li> <li>whistleblowing;</li> <li>work based pension;</li> <li>working time regulations;</li> <li>wrongful dismissal; and</li> <li>any other employment laws relevant to the entity?</li> </ul> <p><i>NB: The above represents a selection of employment law applicable around the world, whereas not all of these will be covered by legislation in each jurisdiction.</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>8. Where necessary, has the entity undertaken a health and safety risk assessment, which is up to date?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>9. Where necessary, has the entity undertaken a fire risk assessment, which is up to date?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>10. Document all areas of non-compliance, ensure that these have been adequately assessed in the L Section of the file and if appropriate, considered in the going concern review. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>11. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>FRAUD AND ERROR/h6> <p>12. Review the following for potential signs of fraud and error (this work might also identify non-compliance with law and regulation or undisclosed related party transactions):</p> <ul> <li>investigations by government departments;</li> <li>payment of fines or penalties;</li> <li>adverse media comment;</li> <li>lavish lifestyles or extensive and potentially unnecessary foreign travel by senior management;</li> <li>aggressive tax management by the entity whether deemed to be tax evasion or avoidance;</li> <li>aggressive earnings management;</li> <li>(other than where they represent part of an authorised remuneration package) assets used for private benefit;</li> <li>complex group structures, including offshore entities where ownership cannot be identified</li> <li>long delays in production of accounting records or financial statements;</li> <li>unauthorised transactions or inadequately recorded transactions;</li> <li>computer problems or other system problems which mean that an adequate audit trail is not given;</li> <li>a poor control environment and lack of segregation of duties;</li> <li>management refusal to provide information;</li> <li>unusual accounting treatments not in accordance with accounting policies adopted by the entity;</li> <li>payments for unspecified services and payments made for goods / services not received / required;</li> <li>sales (including the disposal of fixed assets) or purchases at prices significantly above or below the market price;</li> <li>payment in cash where this appears to be inappropriate;</li> <li>transactions which have no apparent purpose or economic sense;</li> <li>unusual related party transactions; </li> <li>transactions with tax havens, high-risk and non-cooperative jurisdictions (as categorised by FATF) or third countries where the transaction did not originate;</li> <li>sales commissions or agents fees that appear excessive, are undertaken on a split commission basis or are paid before the underlying transaction occurs;</li> <li>unexpected balances and reversal of transactions after the period-end; and</li> <li>unusual investments of funds</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>13. If, during the audit work, there is any suspicion that a document may not be authentic, or has been altered, consider confirming the contents of the document directly with the third party from whom the document originated. <strong>(E, R&O, C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>14. Document all areas of concern, ensure that these have been brought to the attention of the A.E.P. and consider whether these concerns could impact on the audit opinion or whether they draw into question the integrity of senior management and thus whether we should continue to act for the client.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>15. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. Through discussions with the management ensure that all service organisation that process financial information have been identified.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. Ensure that a full list of service organisations used by the entity is noted on the permanent file. This should include (where appropriate):-</p> <ul> <li>Payroll bureau;</li> <li>Outsourced bookkeeper;</li> <li>Accountants involved in the production of the financial statements;</li> <li>Accountants involved in preparing tax and deferred tax computations;</li> <li>Accountants involved in tax compliance work;</li> <li>Third parties who hold and distribute stock on behalf of the entity;</li> <li>Professional inventory counters;</li> <li>Investment custodians; and</li> <li>Investment managers.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Where the service organisation is also the audit practice ensure that adequate consideration has been given to the ethical impact of the non-audit services provided.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Obtain a copy of the letters of engagement between the entity and the service organisation, and ensure the following are documented and understood:-</p> <ul> <li> The terms of the contract;</li> <li> The respective responsibilities of the client and the service organisation;</li> <li> The respective responsibilities of the client and the service organisation;</li> <li> What information is to be provided to and by the service organisation the timeframe for production; and</li> <li> There are appropriate indemnity clauses to cover a performance failure by the service organisation.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. Ensure that the service organization is able to provide a continuing service to the client, and that where appropriate contingency plans are in place if it is not possible for the service to continue, for whatever reason (for example, data loss, fire or liquidation).</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>21. Ensure the permanent file documents the controls that operate regarding the provision of information to, and the receipt of information from, the service organisation (i.e. how is it ensured that accurate information passes between the two entities and that information is transferred by an authorised person).</p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><i>Many service organisation provide a ‘Type 2’ report (as defined in ISA 402). These ‘Type 2’ reports are also sometimes produced by a service organisation’s internal auditors. They include information on the description, design and operating effectiveness of internal controls. Organisations may alternatively provide a ‘Type 1’ report which cover just the description and design of internal controls. </i></p>\r\n<p>22. Review these documents where available and update the PAF regarding the controls operated within the service organisation</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>23. Review the audit approach regarding the work of service organisations to determine whether any reliance is to be placed on their internal controls or whether a purely substantive approach will be adopted. </p> <p><i>For some audit assertions, for example ownership of shares is it unlikely that adequate assurance will be gained via a purely substantive approach. </i></p> <p>Update the planning documentation as necessary and where controls are to be relied upon complete tests 25 and 26. </p> ', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>24. Due to client confidentiality it is unlikely that most service organisations will give third party auditors direct access to their accounting systems and controls. Thus it will only be possible to place reliance on a service organisation’s controls through placing reliance on either an internal or external auditors. Review the Type 2 Report to determine which controls it gives an opinion on, then determine for which audit assertions reliance can be placed.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>25. Ensure that the tests on this audit programme relating to reliance on another auditor or an internal auditor are completed.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>26. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>USING THE WORK OF AN EXPERT (ISA 620)</h6>\r\n<p>27. Ensure that all financial information which has been provided by an expert has been identified, and that the terms of the contract, and the extent of responsibilities of both the client and the expert are understood.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>28. Assess the competency and independence of the expert (for example, recognised professional qualifications, experience of the expert or membership of a recognised trade or professional body).</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>29. Review the assumptions used, and the basis on which the expert’s work has been performed to identify any matters which are either inconsistent with:</p> <ul> <li>prior periods, or</li> <li>information provided by any counterparty; or</li> <li>information provide by other experts; or</li> <li>information provided by the client; or </li> <li>are inconsistent with the auditor’s general knowledge of the client, or other audit evidence.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>30. Where the expert’s work involves the use of source data that is significant to the work of the expert, consider the relevance, completeness and accuracy of the source data.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>31. Ensure that the basis on which the expert’s work has been performed complies with the entity’s accounting policy.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>32. Ensure that the expert’s work has been performed on a timely basis.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>33. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary to enable the auditor to conclude that the expert’s work provides sufficient, appropriate audit evidence in the area.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>CONSIDERING THE WORK OF INTERNAL AUDIT (ISA 610)</h6>\r\n<p>34. If not already documented on the file, document which auditors we are placing reliance on, whether they are internal or external to the organisation and why we are placing reliance on them.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>35. Ensure that confirmation has been obtained from the other audit firm that they are independent of the audit client. </p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>36. For the current year, have we reviewed their working papers and found them to be reliable? If not when was the last time that we reviewed them and has an appropriate audit questionnaire been sent in the current year?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>37. Have any problems with the work of another auditor or internal audit been identified in prior years?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>38. Has the work on which we are seeking to rely been performed in accordance with ISA or equivalent guidance (such as a Type 2 Report)?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>39. Is the other auditor independent from the entity?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>40. Are there any external quality control procedures?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>41. List and perform any tests considered necessary to comply with the requirements of the above ISA’s.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>9. Where necessary, has the entity undertaken a fire risk assessment, which is up to date?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>10. Document all areas of non-compliance, ensure that these have been adequately assessed in the L Section of the file and if appropriate, considered in the going concern review. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>11. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>FRAUD AND ERROR/h6> <p>12. Review the following for potential signs of fraud and error (this work might also identify non-compliance with law and regulation or undisclosed related party transactions):</p> <ul> <li>investigations by government departments;</li> <li>payment of fines or penalties;</li> <li>adverse media comment;</li> <li>lavish lifestyles or extensive and potentially unnecessary foreign travel by senior management;</li> <li>aggressive tax management by the entity whether deemed to be tax evasion or avoidance;</li> <li>aggressive earnings management;</li> <li>(other than where they represent part of an authorised remuneration package) assets used for private benefit;</li> <li>complex group structures, including offshore entities where ownership cannot be identified</li> <li>long delays in production of accounting records or financial statements;</li> <li>unauthorised transactions or inadequately recorded transactions;</li> <li>computer problems or other system problems which mean that an adequate audit trail is not given;</li> <li>a poor control environment and lack of segregation of duties;</li> <li>management refusal to provide information;</li> <li>unusual accounting treatments not in accordance with accounting policies adopted by the entity;</li> <li>payments for unspecified services and payments made for goods / services not received / required;</li> <li>sales (including the disposal of fixed assets) or purchases at prices significantly above or below the market price;</li> <li>payment in cash where this appears to be inappropriate;</li> <li>transactions which have no apparent purpose or economic sense;</li> <li>unusual related party transactions; </li> <li>transactions with tax havens, high-risk and non-cooperative jurisdictions (as categorised by FATF) or third countries where the transaction did not originate;</li> <li>sales commissions or agents fees that appear excessive, are undertaken on a split commission basis or are paid before the underlying transaction occurs;</li> <li>unexpected balances and reversal of transactions after the period-end; and</li> <li>unusual investments of funds</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>13. If, during the audit work, there is any suspicion that a document may not be authentic, or has been altered, consider confirming the contents of the document directly with the third party from whom the document originated. <strong>(E, R&O, C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>14. Document all areas of concern, ensure that these have been brought to the attention of the A.E.P. and consider whether these concerns could impact on the audit opinion or whether they draw into question the integrity of senior management and thus whether we should continue to act for the client.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>15. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. Through discussions with the management ensure that all service organisation that process financial information have been identified.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. Ensure that a full list of service organisations used by the entity is noted on the permanent file. This should include (where appropriate):-</p> <ul> <li>Payroll bureau;</li> <li>Outsourced bookkeeper;</li> <li>Accountants involved in the production of the financial statements;</li> <li>Accountants involved in preparing tax and deferred tax computations;</li> <li>Accountants involved in tax compliance work;</li> <li>Third parties who hold and distribute stock on behalf of the entity;</li> <li>Professional inventory counters;</li> <li>Investment custodians; and</li> <li>Investment managers.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Where the service organisation is also the audit practice ensure that adequate consideration has been given to the ethical impact of the non-audit services provided.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Obtain a copy of the letters of engagement between the entity and the service organisation, and ensure the following are documented and understood:-</p> <ul> <li> The terms of the contract;</li> <li> The respective responsibilities of the client and the service organisation;</li> <li> The respective responsibilities of the client and the service organisation;</li> <li> What information is to be provided to and by the service organisation the timeframe for production; and</li> <li> There are appropriate indemnity clauses to cover a performance failure by the service organisation.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. Ensure that the service organization is able to provide a continuing service to the client, and that where appropriate contingency plans are in place if it is not possible for the service to continue, for whatever reason (for example, data loss, fire or liquidation).</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>21. Ensure the permanent file documents the controls that operate regarding the provision of information to, and the receipt of information from, the service organisation (i.e. how is it ensured that accurate information passes between the two entities and that information is transferred by an authorised person).</p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><i>Many service organisation provide a ‘Type 2’ report (as defined in ISA 402). These ‘Type 2’ reports are also sometimes produced by a service organisation’s internal auditors. They include information on the description, design and operating effectiveness of internal controls. Organisations may alternatively provide a ‘Type 1’ report which cover just the description and design of internal controls. </i></p>\r\n<p>22. Review these documents where available and update the PAF regarding the controls operated within the service organisation</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>23. Review the audit approach regarding the work of service organisations to determine whether any reliance is to be placed on their internal controls or whether a purely substantive approach will be adopted. </p> <p><i>For some audit assertions, for example ownership of shares is it unlikely that adequate assurance will be gained via a purely substantive approach. </i></p> <p>Update the planning documentation as necessary and where controls are to be relied upon complete tests 25 and 26. </p> ', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>24. Due to client confidentiality it is unlikely that most service organisations will give third party auditors direct access to their accounting systems and controls. Thus it will only be possible to place reliance on a service organisation’s controls through placing reliance on either an internal or external auditors. Review the Type 2 Report to determine which controls it gives an opinion on, then determine for which audit assertions reliance can be placed.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>25. Ensure that the tests on this audit programme relating to reliance on another auditor or an internal auditor are completed.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>26. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>USING THE WORK OF AN EXPERT (ISA 620)</h6>\r\n<p>27. Ensure that all financial information which has been provided by an expert has been identified, and that the terms of the contract, and the extent of responsibilities of both the client and the expert are understood.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>28. Assess the competency and independence of the expert (for example, recognised professional qualifications, experience of the expert or membership of a recognised trade or professional body).</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>29. Review the assumptions used, and the basis on which the expert’s work has been performed to identify any matters which are either inconsistent with:</p> <ul> <li>prior periods, or</li> <li>information provided by any counterparty; or</li> <li>information provide by other experts; or</li> <li>information provided by the client; or </li> <li>are inconsistent with the auditor’s general knowledge of the client, or other audit evidence.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>30. Where the expert’s work involves the use of source data that is significant to the work of the expert, consider the relevance, completeness and accuracy of the source data.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>31. Ensure that the basis on which the expert’s work has been performed complies with the entity’s accounting policy.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>32. Ensure that the expert’s work has been performed on a timely basis.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>33. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary to enable the auditor to conclude that the expert’s work provides sufficient, appropriate audit evidence in the area.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>CONSIDERING THE WORK OF INTERNAL AUDIT (ISA 610)</h6>\r\n<p>34. If not already documented on the file, document which auditors we are placing reliance on, whether they are internal or external to the organisation and why we are placing reliance on them.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>35. Ensure that confirmation has been obtained from the other audit firm that they are independent of the audit client. </p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>36. For the current year, have we reviewed their working papers and found them to be reliable? If not when was the last time that we reviewed them and has an appropriate audit questionnaire been sent in the current year?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>37. Have any problems with the work of another auditor or internal audit been identified in prior years?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>38. Has the work on which we are seeking to rely been performed in accordance with ISA or equivalent guidance (such as a Type 2 Report)?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>39. Is the other auditor independent from the entity?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>40. Are there any external quality control procedures?</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>41. List and perform any tests considered necessary to comply with the requirements of the above ISA’s.</p>', '', '', '', '2.12 N2', '2.12 N2', '30', 'Active', '2024-03-21 17:36:06')

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p>1.	In respect of any material accounting estimates from the prior period, review how they have been utilised in the current period to determine their reasonableness.</p>
<p><i>If this work has been undertaken in other sections of the file a summary schedule should be produced to allow an overall conclusion to be reached.</i></p>
    [1] => <p>2.	Ensure that Appendix 1.7 (Accounting Estimates) has been completed and concluded.</p>
    [2] => <p>3.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
    [3] => <h6>LAW AND REGULATION</h6>
<p>4.	Obtain details of the law and regulations which:</p>
<ul>
    <li>	are central to the continuing operation of the entity; or</li>
    <li>	would lead to a material financial penalty if not complied with; or</li>
    <li>	are a contractual or licensing arrangement which is of critical importance to the entity; or</li>
    <li>	otherwise could have a material effect on the operation of the entity.</li>
</ul>
<p>Ensure that the permanent file has also been updated with these details.</p>
    [4] => <p>5.	Discuss with management procedures for compliance with relevant law and regulations.  Ensure the permanent file has also been updated with these details.</p>
    [5] => <p>6.	Review the following for evidence of non-compliance with law and regulations:</p>
<ul>
    <li>	correspondence with legal advisors and regulatory bodies;</li>
    <li>	correspondence with government bodies (including taxation authorities);</li>
    <li>	shareholder and board minutes; and</li>
    <li>	reports commissioned from experts.</li>
</ul>
    [6] => <p>7.	Consider the entity’s knowledge of employment law. Are there procedures in place to adequately consider areas such as the following, where legislation covers the relevant areas:</p>
<ul>
    <li>data protection, surveillance and privacy at work;</li>
    <li>discrimination (covering age (including retirement); disability, race, religion, sex and sexual orientation);</li>
    <li>discipline and grievance procedures;</li>
    <li>employee status;</li>
    <li>equal pay;</li>
    <li>fixed-term working;</li>
    <li>flexible working, parental rights and family-friendly procedures;</li>
    <li>maternity, paternity, shared parental and adoption leave and pay;</li>
    <li>minimum and living wage;</li>
    <li>part time working;</li>
    <li>recruitment and selection;</li>
    <li>redundancy;</li>
    <li>terms and conditions of employment;</li>
    <li>trade union recognition and industrial action;</li>
    <li>whistleblowing;</li>
    <li>work based pension;</li>
    <li>working time regulations;</li>
    <li>wrongful dismissal; and</li>
    <li>any other employment laws relevant to the entity?</li>
</ul>
<p><i>NB: The above represents a selection of employment law applicable around the world, whereas not all of these will be covered by legislation in each jurisdiction.</i></p>
    [7] => <p>8.	Where necessary, has the entity undertaken a health and safety risk assessment, which is up to date?</p>
    [8] => <p>9.	Where necessary, has the entity undertaken a fire risk assessment, which is up to date?</p>
    [9] => <p>10.	Document all areas of non-compliance, ensure that these have been adequately assessed in the L Section of the file and if appropriate, considered in the going concern review.  <strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [10] => <p>11.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
    [11] => <h6>FRAUD AND ERROR/h6>
<p>12.	Review the following for potential signs of fraud and error (this work might also identify non-compliance with law and regulation or undisclosed related party transactions):</p>
<ul>
    <li>investigations by government departments;</li>
    <li>payment of fines or penalties;</li>
    <li>adverse media comment;</li>
    <li>lavish lifestyles or extensive and potentially unnecessary foreign travel by senior management;</li>
    <li>aggressive tax management by the entity whether deemed to be tax evasion or avoidance;</li>
    <li>aggressive earnings management;</li>
    <li>(other than where they represent part of an authorised remuneration package) assets used for private benefit;</li>
    <li>complex group structures, including offshore entities where ownership cannot be identified</li>
    <li>long delays in production of accounting records or financial statements;</li>
    <li>unauthorised transactions or inadequately recorded transactions;</li>
    <li>computer problems or other system problems which mean that an adequate audit trail is not given;</li>
    <li>a poor control environment and lack of segregation of duties;</li>
    <li>management refusal to provide information;</li>
    <li>unusual accounting treatments not in accordance with accounting policies adopted by the entity;</li>
    <li>payments for unspecified services and payments made for goods / services not received / required;</li>
    <li>sales (including the disposal of fixed assets) or purchases at prices significantly above or below the market price;</li>
    <li>payment in cash where this appears to be inappropriate;</li>
    <li>transactions which have no apparent purpose or economic sense;</li>
    <li>unusual related party transactions; </li>
    <li>transactions with tax havens, high-risk and non-cooperative jurisdictions (as categorised by FATF) or third countries where the transaction did not originate;</li>
    <li>sales commissions or agents fees that appear excessive, are undertaken on a split commission basis or are paid before the underlying transaction occurs;</li>
    <li>unexpected balances and reversal of transactions after the period-end; and</li>
    <li>unusual investments of funds</li>
</ul>
    [12] => <p>13.	If, during the audit work, there is any suspicion that a document may not be authentic, or has been altered, consider confirming the contents of the document directly with the third party from whom the document originated. <strong>(E, R&O, C)</strong></p>
    [13] => <p>14.	Document all areas of concern, ensure that these have been brought to the attention of the A.E.P. and consider whether these concerns could impact on the audit opinion or whether they draw into question the integrity of senior management and thus whether we should continue to act for the client.</p>
    [14] => <p>15.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
    [15] => <p>16.	Through discussions with the management ensure that all service organisation that process financial information have been identified.</p>
    [16] => <p>17.	Ensure that a full list of service organisations used by the entity is noted on the permanent file.  This should include (where appropriate):-</p>
<ul>
    <li>Payroll bureau;</li>
    <li>Outsourced bookkeeper;</li>
    <li>Accountants involved in the production of the financial statements;</li>
    <li>Accountants involved in preparing tax and deferred tax computations;</li>
    <li>Accountants involved in tax compliance work;</li>
    <li>Third parties who hold and distribute stock on behalf of the entity;</li>
    <li>Professional inventory counters;</li>
    <li>Investment custodians; and</li>
    <li>Investment managers.</li>
</ul>
    [17] => <p>18.	Where the service organisation is also the audit practice ensure that adequate consideration has been given to the ethical impact of the non-audit services provided.</p>
    [18] => <p>19.	Obtain a copy of the letters of engagement between the entity and the service organisation, and ensure the following are documented and understood:-</p>
<ul>
    <li>	The terms of the contract;</li>
    <li>	The respective responsibilities of the client and the service organisation;</li>
    <li>	The respective responsibilities of the client and the service organisation;</li>
    <li>	What information is to be provided to and by the service organisation the timeframe for production; and</li>
    <li>	There are appropriate indemnity clauses to cover a performance failure by the service organisation.</li>
</ul>
    [19] => <p>20.	Ensure that the service organization is able to provide a continuing service to the client, and that where appropriate contingency plans are in place if it is not possible for the service to continue, for whatever reason (for example, data loss, fire or liquidation).</p>
    [20] => <p>21.	Ensure the permanent file documents the controls that operate regarding the provision of information to, and the receipt of information from, the service organisation (i.e. how is it ensured that accurate information passes between the two entities and that information is transferred by an authorised person).</p>

    [21] => <p><i>Many service organisation provide a ‘Type 2’ report (as defined in ISA 402). These ‘Type 2’ reports are also sometimes produced by a service organisation’s internal auditors. They include information on the description, design and operating effectiveness of internal controls.  Organisations may alternatively provide a ‘Type 1’ report which cover just the description and design of internal controls. </i></p>
<p>22.	Review these documents where available and update the PAF regarding the controls operated within the service organisation</p>
    [22] => <p>23.	Review the audit approach regarding the work of service organisations to determine whether any reliance is to be placed on their internal controls or whether a purely substantive approach will be adopted. </p>
<p><i>For some audit assertions, for example ownership of shares is it unlikely that adequate assurance will be gained via a purely substantive approach.  </i></p>
<p>Update the planning documentation as necessary and where controls are to be relied upon complete tests 25 and 26. </p>

    [23] => <p>24.	Due to client confidentiality it is unlikely that most service organisations will give third party auditors direct access to their accounting systems and controls. Thus it will only be possible to place reliance on a service organisation’s controls through placing reliance on either an internal or external auditors.  Review the Type 2 Report to determine which controls it gives an opinion on, then determine for which audit assertions reliance can be placed.</p>
    [24] => <p>25.	Ensure that the tests on this audit programme relating to reliance on another auditor or an internal auditor are completed.</p>
    [25] => <p>26.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
    [26] => <h6>USING THE WORK OF AN EXPERT (ISA 620)</h6>
<p>27.	Ensure that all financial information which has been provided by an expert has been identified, and that the terms of the contract, and the extent of responsibilities of both the client and the expert are understood.</p>
    [27] => <p>28.	Assess the competency and independence of the expert (for example, recognised professional qualifications, experience of the expert or membership of a recognised trade or professional body).</p>
    [28] => <p>29.	Review the assumptions used, and the basis on which the expert’s work has been performed to identify any matters which are either inconsistent with:</p>
<ul>
    <li>prior periods, or</li>
    <li>information provided by any counterparty; or</li>
    <li>information provide by other experts; or</li>
    <li>information provided by the client; or </li>
    <li>are inconsistent with the auditor’s general knowledge of the client, or other audit evidence.</li>
</ul>
    [29] => <p>30.	Where the expert’s work involves the use of source data that is significant to the work of the expert, consider the relevance, completeness and accuracy of the source data.</p>
    [30] => <p>31.	Ensure that the basis on which the expert’s work has been performed complies with the entity’s accounting policy.</p>
    [31] => <p>32.	Ensure that the expert’s work has been performed on a timely basis.</p>
    [32] => <p>33.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary to enable the auditor to conclude that the expert’s work provides sufficient, appropriate audit evidence in the area.</p>
    [33] => <h6>CONSIDERING THE WORK OF INTERNAL AUDIT (ISA 610)</h6>
<p>34.	If not already documented on the file, document which auditors we are placing reliance on, whether they are internal or external to the organisation and why we are placing reliance on them.</p>
    [34] => <p>35.	Ensure that confirmation has been obtained from the other audit firm that they are independent of the audit client. </p>
    [35] => <p>36.	For the current year, have we reviewed their working papers and found them to be reliable?  If not when was the last time that we reviewed them and has an appropriate audit questionnaire been sent in the current year?</p>
    [36] => <p>37.	Have any problems with the work of another auditor or internal audit been identified in prior years?</p>
    [37] => <p>38.	Has the work on which we are seeking to rely been performed in accordance with ISA or equivalent guidance (such as a Type 2 Report)?</p>
    [38] => <p>39.	Is the other auditor independent from the entity?</p>
    [39] => <p>40.	Are there any external quality control procedures?</p>
    [40] => <p>41.	List and perform any tests considered necessary to comply with the requirements of the above ISA’s.</p>
)
